DOC.brief_summary: The overall goal study determine health benefit associate 2005 Dietary Guidelines physical activity prescription healthy , peri-menopausal woman . The 2005 Dietary Guidelines specifically state avoid unhealthy weight gain , adult participate 60 minute moderate vigorous intensity physical activity day week .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluating Health Benefits Physical Activity Recommendations Dietary Guidelines
DOC.detailed_description: This study randomize control trial conduct 6 7 month period . Subjects enrol cohort randomly assign one two group . - Group 1 ( PA ) : physical activity intervention consist brisk walk aerobic-type activity ( 6 day per week ) , resistance exercise ( use free weight , resistance band weight stack weight lift , 3 day per week ) , 'active lifestyle ' activity garden , dance , participation sporting activity . The total time spent activity add ~60 min/day 6 days/week ( ~360 minute per week ) . - Group 2 ( CON ) : control group maintain usual level physical activity participate testing protocol , record keep , interview schedule PA . This group offer opportunity gym membership/access training facility completion 6-month period serving control . The specific aim pilot study : - Assess participant 's level compliance/adherence - Assess dietary habit study participant become physically active . - Identify barrier physical activity specific population . - Measure change body composition , physical fitness energy expenditure . - Evaluate change chronic disease risk factor . - Determine regular physical activity reduce chronic stress .
DOC.criteria: Body Mass Index : 18.5 29.9 kg/m2 Perimenopause , determine selfreport menstrual history symptom previous 12 month Sedentary lifestyle Individuals already physically active Pregnant nursing within last 6 month Plan become pregnant study Musculoskeletal disease disorder expect limit participation physical activity Orthopedic injuries Inflammatory arthritis autoimmune disorder Neuromuscular disorder include multiple sclerosis , amyotrophic lateral sclerosis , Parkinson 's disease Menopause confirm Use tobacco product Family history premature cardiovascular disease define ACSM guideline Cardiovascular include history cardiac arrest ; coronary heart disease , complex ventricular arrhythmia atrial arrhythmia rest exercise , congestive heart failure , cardiomyopathy , hemodynamically significant valvular heart disease , leave bundle block , cardiac pacemaker ; implant cardiac defibrillator ; history aortic aneurysm least 7 cm diameter aortic aneurysm repair ; rest heart rate < 45 beat per minute > 100 beat per minute Chronic lung disease result dyspnea rest minimal exertion , lung disease result hypoxia hypercapnia rest exercise , pulmonary embolus within 6 month , active tuberculosis Presence risk factor cardiovascular metabolic disease : Hypertension ( SBP ≥140 mm Hg and/or DBP ≥ 90 mm Hg ) ; hypertension treat beta adrenergic blocker regardless blood pressure Elevated fast LDL cholesterol ( ≥160 mg/dL ) Elevated fast triglyceride ( ≥300 mg/dL ) Diagnosed diabetes mellitus elevate fast glucose ( ≥126 mg/dL ) , adrenal disease , acromegaly , thyroid disease require medication change treatment within previous 3 month Weight change great 10 lb precede 6 month Medications : chronic corticosteroid use need oral corticosteroid twice last 12 month , antipsychotic medication , beta adrenergic blocker , medication weight loss ( include sibutramine , orlistat , phentermine , phendimetrazine , topiramate , zonisamide ) , immunosuppressant , amphetamine stimulant , medication know influence body weight Travel plan permit full participation
